definition: to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick

sentences.english: When you know where you re headed, you can choose any route to get there.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你知道了目标，路径就可以任你挑选了。

sentences.english: All the sites I chose for this article broke new ground in this area.
sentences.chinese: 本文中挑选的所有站点都在业内开拓了新天地。

sentences.english: In single-dispatch polymorphism, the object that "owns" a method is singled out.
sentences.chinese: 在单分派多态性中，挑选出“拥有”方法的对象。

sentences.english: One day,his mum told him to sort out his life.
sentences.chinese: 一天，他的妈妈告诉他要挑选一下自己的生活。

sentences.english: You can also pick from a list of pre-defined ABG types.
sentences.chinese: 你还可以从一个预先定义的ABG类型当中进行挑选。

sentences.english: Jury selection begins today in O. J. Simpson's latest trial.
sentences.chinese: 今天开始挑选辛普森一案最新审判中的陪审团成员。

sentences.english: Was it possible that the plaintiffs had colluded with Beristain to handpick the interviewees?
sentences.chinese: 是否有可能是原告勾结贝斯坦并精心挑选了受访者？

sentences.english: Selected applicants will then be invited to submit a full application.
sentences.chinese: 挑选出的申请会再通知其提交一份全面的申请报告。

sentences.english: They choose Mr. Wang as their advisor .
sentences.chinese: 他们挑选王先生当他们的顾问。

sentences.english: Today, jeans come in many colors, styles and prices.
sentences.chinese: 今天，牛仔裤有很多色泽，款式和价格任你挑选。

sentences.english: You can follow one of any number of processes in designing the user interface.
sentences.chinese: 在大量用户界面设计流程中可以任意挑选一个来遵循。

sentences.english: V. I will choose my friends wisely.
We have a good assortment of goods to choose from.
sentences.chinese: 本公司货色齐全，花色多样，任凭挑选。

sentences.english: It was raining heavily, whether or not we should choose to hide in the refuge.
sentences.chinese: 雨上的很小，人们能否当要挑选藏正在躲威严港外。

sentences.english: Selection gas stoves mainly to view its security functions.
sentences.chinese: 挑选燃气灶主要是看它的安全性能。

sentences.english: The goal, one said, is to avoid picking winners.
sentences.chinese: 其中一人说，目标就是避免去挑选赢家。

definition: to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to win an election/to get a position by passing the imperial exam
